extendedIngredients.name: banana
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cups mashed very ripe banana (about 3 bananas)

extendedIngredients.name: dark chocolate chips
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3/4 cup (135 grams) dark chocolate chips (I used half semi-sweet, half dark chocolate)

extendedIngredients.name: low fat plain yogurt
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/3 cup (60 grams) plain low fat yogurt

extendedIngredients.name: raspberries
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup (150 grams) halved raspberries, tossed in 1 Tablespoon (8 grams) all-purpose flour

extendedIngredients.name: unsalted butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 Tablespoons (60 grams) unsalted butter, softened to room temp

extendedIngredients.name: white whole wheat flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups (250 grams) white whole wheat flour (or all-purpose flour)

recipes.title: Dark Chocolate Raspberry Banana Bread

winePairing.pairingText: Dessert Bread can be paired with Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. One wine you could try is NV Solera Cream Sherry. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 350F. Spray a 9x5-inch loaf pan with cooking spray.In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda and salt. Set aside. In a separate large bowl, beat the sugar and butter with a stand or handheld mixer on medium speed until well blended - about 1 minute. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the mashed banana, yogurt, and vanilla. Continue beating until blended.Slowly stir in the flour mixture by hand, until *just combined* - do not overmix. Fold in the chocolate chips and then gently stir in the raspberries - you do not want the raspberries to bleed their color. You may sprinkle a few raspberries + chocolate chips on top for looks as well.The batter will be very thick, so spoon it into the prepared loaf pan rather than pouring it. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 15 minutes in the pan on a wire rack. Remove from pan and cool completely on the wire rack.Recipe from Recipe Boy

steps.step: Preheat oven to 350F. Spray a 9x5-inch loaf pan with cooking spray.In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda and salt. Set aside. In a separate large bowl, beat the sugar and butter with a stand or handheld mixer on medium speed until well blended - about 1 minute.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.

Add the mashed banana, yogurt, and vanilla. Continue beating until blended.Slowly stir in the flour mixture by hand, until *just combined* - do not overmix. Fold in the chocolate chips and then gently stir in the raspberries - you do not want the raspberries to bleed their color. You may sprinkle a few raspberries + chocolate chips on top for looks as well.The batter will be very thick, so spoon it into the prepared loaf pan rather than pouring it.
Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 15 minutes in the pan on a wire rack.
Remove from pan and cool completely on the wire rack.Recipe from Recipe Boy
